Issues.Title: fix(ngcc): switch ngcc over to use the `TraitCompiler`
Issues.Body:
fix(ngcc): do not attempt compilation when analysis fails

In #34288, ngtsc was refactored to separate the result of the analysis
and resolve phase for more granular incremental rebuilds. In this model,
any errors in one phase transition the trait into an error state, which
prevents it from being ran through subsequent phases. The ngcc compiler
on the other hand did not adopt this strict error model, which would
cause incomplete metadata‚Äîdue to errors in earlier phases‚Äîto be offered
for compilation that could result in a hard crash.

This commit updates ngcc to take advantage of ngtsc's `TraitCompiler`,
that internally manages all Ivy classes that are part of the
compilation. This effectively replaces ngcc's own `AnalyzedFile` and
`AnalyzedClass` types, together with all of the logic to drive the
`DecoratorHandler`s. All of this is now handled in the `TraitCompiler`,
benefiting from its explicit state transitions of `Trait`s so that the
ngcc crash is a thing of the past.

Fixes #34500
Resolves FW-1788
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ngcc): switch ngcc over to use the `TraitCompiler`" (#34889)

Issues.Title: refactor(language-service): Consistent naming between ts and ng LanguageService
Issues.Body:
This commit makes the Angular Language Service interface a strict subset
of TypeScript Language Service by renaming all methods to be
consistent with TypeScript's.

| Old Name | New Name |
| --- | --- |
| `getDiagnostics` | `getSemanticDiagnostics` |
| `getCompletionsAt` | `getCompletionsAtPosition` |
| `getDefinitionAt` | `getDefinitionAndBoundSpan` |
| `getHoverAt` | `getQuickInfoAtPosition` |


The custom Angular `LanguageService` interface was needed before the
inception of TypeScript tsserver plugin, but is now obsolete since
Angular LS is a proper tsserver plugin.

This allows us to easily adapt to upstream TS changes in the future, and
also allows us to reuse all data types defined in TypeScript.

Issues.Title: refactor(ivy): introduce the 'core' package and split apart NgtscProgram
Issues.Body:
Previously, NgtscProgram lived in the main @angular/compiler-cli package
alongside the legacy View Engine compiler. As a result, the main package
depended on all of the ngtsc internal packages, and a significant portion of
ngtsc logic lived in NgtscProgram.

This commit refactors NgtscProgram and moves the main logic of compilation
into a new 'core' package. The new package defines a new API which enables
implementers of TypeScript compilers (compilers built using the TS API) to
support Angular transpilation as well. It involves a new NgCompiler type
which takes a ts.Program and performs Angular analysis and transformations,
as well as an NgCompilerHost which wraps an input ts.CompilerHost and adds
any extra Angular files.

Together, these two classes are used to implement a new NgtscProgram which
adapts the legacy api.Program interface used by the View Engine compiler
onto operations on the new types. The new NgtscProgram implementation is
significantly smaller and easier to reason about.

The new NgCompilerHost replaces the previous GeneratedShimsHostWrapper which
lived in the 'shims' package.

A new 'resource' package is added to support the HostResourceLoader which
previously lived in the outer compiler package.

As a result of the refactoring, the dependencies of the outer
@angular/compiler-cli package on ngtsc internal packages are significantly
trimmed.

This refactoring was driven by the desire to build a plugin interface to the
compiler so that tsc_wrapped (another consumer of the TS compiler APIs) can
perform Angular transpilation on user request.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(ivy): introduce the 'core' package and split apart NgtscProgram" (#34887)

# üêû bug report

After running `ng serve` in [this project](https://github.com/mgechev/ngx-charts/tree/compiler-bug), I get:

```
ERROR in Cannot read property 'members' of undefined
```

### Affected Package

```
@angular/compiler
```


### Is this a regression?

Looks like it is. I noticed it in the latest Ivy RC.


### Description

The project references missing symbols. If you open `tooltip.module.ts`, you'll notice that the `TooltipModule` imports `TooltipContentComponent` which does not exist. Trying to compile the project using `tsc` reveals this error. Running `ng serve`, however, throws the generic `ERROR in Cannot read property 'members' of undefined`.


## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

Available [here]([this project](https://github.com/mgechev/ngx-charts/tree/compiler-bug)) (notice the branch).

## üî• Exception or Error

```
ERROR in Cannot read property 'members' of undefined
```

## üåç  Your Environment

**Angular Version:**

```
@angular/cli@9.0.0-rc.7
@angular/compiler@9.0.0-rc.7
```

Issues.Title: angular 9 with transitive template projection fails
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package This issue is most probably caused by `@angular/core`, `@angular/cli` and `@angular/compiler-cli` or a combination of the above. ### Is this a regression? This is a regression, it works well with Angular 8 and appears at least with angular **9.0.0-next.0**, **9.0.0-rc.0** and **9.0.0-rc.9** (I'haven't tested the other releases). ### Description A template (`Hello`) is projected into a child component that itself projects the template farther to a grand child. The grand child then tries to display the template with `ngTemplateOutlet` but nothing is shown. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction As I wasn't able to reproduce the problem on StackBlitz, I set up a minimal GitHub repo at https://github.com/gillerr/ngTemplateoutlet. The **master** branch (https://github.com/gillerr/ngTemplateoutlet/tree/master/src/app) has been created with `ng new ngTemplateoutlet` and cleaned up of anything irrelevant. It features Angular 8 and works as expected. The **angular9** branch (https://github.com/gillerr/ngTemplateoutlet/tree/angular9/src/app) contains the exact same code, I only executed `ng update @angular/core@9.0.0-next.0 @angular/cli@9.0.0-next.0` and pushed relevant files (`angular.json`, `package.json`, `package-lock.json` and `tsconfig.app.json`). I also had to manually update `typescript`. The **workaround** branch (https://github.com/gillerr/ngTemplateoutlet/tree/workaround/src/app) shows a workaround that solves the problem but not in a way that satisfies me. The templates are passed through an `Input` instead of being projected. ## üî• Exception or Error No error are shown, the templates' content simply is not displayed. ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 


     _                      _                 ____ _     ___
    / \   _ __   __ _ _   _| | __ _ _ __     / ___| |   |_ _|
   / ‚ñ≥ \ | '_ \ / _` | | | | |/ _` | '__|   | |   | |    | |

                |___/

# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages the are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: --> This feature request is @angular/router

### Description

When I am in CompA and then I manually navigate to CompB (passing dateFrom and dateTo parameters from CompA to CompB) when I hit back button I want to use the dateFrom and dateTo to CompA again. Currently there is not any way to pass parameters when back button of browser is clicked and be able to identify in CompA that navigation started from CompB after back button was clicked and not a link menu was clicked


### Describe the solution you'd like
```event.navigationTrigger``` that exists on ```NavigationEnd``` can be also added in ```RoutesRecognized```

Issues.Title: Scrolling to top in angular8 after route change not working
Issues.Body:
I've build an Angular application with server side rendering mode (SSR), I have a few components, from my home page when I go to out services page, and scroll down, and go back to home page, the scroll is set to bottom of page.

I would like to set my scroll to top every time I open up a component.

I am using Angular8.2, I tried using the option available in router, `{scrollPositionRestoration : 'enabled'}` or `{scrollPositionRestoration : 'top'}` but it didn't work on Chrome nor on Chrome mobile or on Edge.

Other than that, I tried to set a listener on router and using `window.scrollTo(0,0)` in the `ngAfterViewChecked()` method of app.component.ts file, that didn't work either!
I just want my scroll bar at top. Its such a naive thing but it has frustrated me now!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Scrolling to top in angular8 after route change not working" (#34879)

Issues.Title: Datepicker Component Does Not Honor `updateOn` Configuration When No Year Is Present
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue _may be_ caused by package @angular/forms ### Is this a regression? No information. ### Description When `MatDatepickerComponent` is coupled to a `FormControl`, and said `FormControl` has a configuration with the option `updateOn: 'blur'`, the `updateOn` is not honored in certain cases. One such instance I have discovered is when editing the date with a keyboard, if the year is removed `valueChanges` will fire on the field with (almost) every keystroke. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction (open console) https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-dxyamu?file=src/app/datepicker-start-view-example.ts ![matdatepicker valuechanges](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2379809/72750090-b6f35e00-3b70-11ea-85d7-5758a9a970e9.gif) ## üî• Exception or Error 

// Not applicable
## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

  "dependencies": {
    "@angular/animations": "^8.2.9",
    "@angular/cdk": "~8.2.2",
    "@angular/common": "^8.2.9",
    "@angular/compiler": "^8.2.9",
    "@angular/core": "^8.2.9",
    "@angular/forms": "^8.2.9",
    "@angular/material": "~8.2.2",
    "@angular/material-moment-adapter": "~8.2.2",
    "@angular/platform-browser": "^8.2.9",
    "@angular/platform-browser-dynamic": "^8.2.9",
    "@angular/router": "^8.2.9"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "@angular-devkit/build-angular": "^0.803.8",
    "@angular/cli": "^8.3.8",
    "@angular/compiler-cli": "^8.2.9",
    "@angular/language-service": "^8.2.9"
  }
**Anything else relevant?** Tested in Chrome and FireFox the issue is present in both browsers with slightly different behavior in each: * FireFox - After removing the year, every keystroke fires `valueChanges` * Chrome - After removing the year, deleting a slash, adding a slash, or deleting the last character to the right of a slash (when 2 or more characters were originally present) will fire `valueChanges` This is demonstrable both on StackBlitz (Angular ~8), as well as our organization's own application (Angular ~7).

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): DebugNode.classes not working on SVG elements
Issues.Body:
Fixes Ivy throwing an error when trying to access the `DebugNode.classes` of an SVG element. The problem is that the `className` of an SVG element is an `SVGAnimatedString`, rather than a plain string.

Fixes #34868.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ivy): DebugNode.classes not working on SVG elements" (#34872)

Issues.Title: fix(ngcc): update `package.json` deterministically
Issues.Body:
Ngcc adds properties to the `package.json` files of the entry-points it processes to mark them as processed for a format and point to the created Ivy entry-points (in case of `--create-ivy-entry-points`). When running ngcc in parallel mode (which is the default for the standalone ngcc command), multiple formats can be processed simultaneously for the same entry-point and the order of completion is not deterministic.

Previously, ngcc would append new properties at the end of the target object in `package.json` as soon as the format processing was completed. As a result, the order of properties in the resulting `package.json` (when processing multiple formats for an entry-point in parallel) was not deterministic. For tools that use file hashes for caching purposes (such as Bazel), this lead to a high probability of cache misses.

This commit fixes the problem by ensuring that the position of properties added to `package.json` files is deterministic and independent of the order in which each format is processed.

Jira issue: [FW-1801](https://angular-team.atlassian.net/browse/FW-1801)

Fixes #34635.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ngcc): update `package.json` deterministically" (#34870)

Issues.Title: DebugElement.classes does not work for SVG elements in Ivy
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/core ### Is this a regression? Yes. Angular 8.x and before ### Description In unit tests when inspecting the `classes` property of a `DebugElement` which wraps an SVGElement, the error: ``` TypeError: element.className.split is not a function ``` is thrown. I can reproduce this error in the web browser by selecting an arbitrary SVG element (e.g. `document.querySelector('svg')` and accessing `svgElement.classList.split(' ');` on this element. Issues.Title: NGC rebuild performance improvements (Ivy & AoT)
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
This feature request is for **@angular/compiler-cli**


### Description
Thanks to the team my issue https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/33986 was fixed in 9rc4 build. 
I open this feature request to ask (prioritize) others impovements regarding `ngc rebuild`, actually in large project 8-15s rebuild (on each file change) is pretty long.

### Repro
I think I succeed to repro a rebuild slowness by multiply by 2 the number of components (now 817) in my last issue repro [ng-speed-rebuild](https://github.com/elvisbegovic/ng-speed-rebuild)
Clone `master` branch, create `ngcc` ivy entry points, run `npm run ngc` to start the project.
Here's [ngc-9rc9.cpuprofile](https://drive.google.com/open?id=1YAo9yzNtU-2kv8w18bMVkDP-Ins5VpWp) of an isolated rebuild of the repro.

### Describe the solution you'd like
Out of scope to me. From what I've learned/heard the long phase is: emitting and reparse all components on each rebuild


### Describe alternatives you've considered
1. I tried on two differents hardware (VM ubuntu & win10) rebuild time is pretty same.
2. I can't be sure if ng-speed-rebuild repro is reflecting our private project because we have a lot of imports/exports/shared components.  On our private project we have 850 components, if it can help here you are a `.cpuprofile` of an isolated ngc rebuild of our private project [private-project-ngc-9rc9.cpuprofile](https://drive.google.com/open?id=1sKsde1Mv-CQD7iarjOg1nM9H87OWKM-9)
3. NOTE: With CLI 9rc9 `ng serve` rebuild is weird and really longer https://github.com/elvisbegovic/ng-speed-rebuild#ng-serve-9rc9-rebuild--83s---7s---5s---15s---17s---14s

### Other
Might be related to https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/34796 (wait repro)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "NGC rebuild performance improvements (Ivy & AoT)" (#34867)

Issues.Title: ViewContainerRef.createComponent with svg component
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report

### Affected Package
@angular/core

### Is this a regression?
No

### Description

Say I have this svg path component
```ts
@Component({
  selector: 'svg:g[app-path]', // have tried with both svg:g[app-path] and g[app-path]
  templateUrl: './path.component.html',
  styleUrls: ['./path.component.css']
})
export class PathComponent {}
```

When using ViewContainerRef and ComponentFactoryResolver to dynamically load a component.
It doesn't create the element with the correct namespace.

The component is created, but if I look into the properties panel of chrome devtools I can see that it's not correctly being set as a SVGGElement, but instead a HTMLUnknownElement.

I'm guessing this is because somewhere, someone isn't paying attention to that the component getting loaded could be an svg component.

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-dynamically-load-svg?file=README.md

## üî• Exception or Error
HTMLUnknownElement instead of SVGGElement


## üåç  Your Environment

**Angular Version:**
Angular 9-rc.9 locally
And stackblitz, which is running 8, same problem.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ViewContainerRef.createComponent with svg component" (#34866)

# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages the are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: --> This feature request is for `@angular/core`.


### Description


We should register component in NgModule.

Can we register components/pipes/directives used in components.

Vue example: [Local Registration in a Module System](https://vuejs.org/v2/guide/components-registration.html#Local-Registration-in-a-Module-System).


### Describe the solution you'd like 

```ts
@Component(...)
@ComponentDeps({
   declarations: [...] //*** extra component/directive/pipe we want*** same as ng module
})
export class LocalComponent {
 ...
}
```

### Describe alternatives you've considered

* This may be achieved with ivy renderer.
* This need update angular language service support.
* It will be better if we can change selector name.

Issues.Title: build: update sass to version 1.25.0
Issues.Body:
This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Type | Update | Change |
|---|---|---|---|
| [sass](https://togithub.com/sass/dart-sass) | dependencies | minor | [`1.24.5` -> `1.25.0`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/sass/1.24.5/1.25.0) |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>sass/dart-sass</summary>

### [`v1.25.0`](https://togithub.com/sass/dart-sass/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​1250)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/sass/dart-sass/compare/1.24.5...1.25.0)

-   Add functions to the built-in "sass:math" module.

    -   `clamp($min, $number, $max)`. Clamps `$number` in between `$min` and `$max`.

    -   `hypot($numbers...)`. Given _n_ numbers, outputs the length of the
        _n_-dimensional vector that has components equal to each of the inputs.

    -   Exponential. All inputs must be unitless.

        -   `log($number)` or `log($number, $base)`. If no base is provided, performs
             a natural log.
        -   `pow($base, $exponent)`
        -   `sqrt($number)`

    -   Trigonometric. The input must be an angle. If no unit is given, the input is
        assumed to be in `rad`.

        -   `cos($number)`
        -   `sin($number)`
        -   `tan($number)`

    -   Inverse trigonometric. The output is in `deg`.
        -   `acos($number)`. Input must be unitless.
        -   `asin($number)`. Input must be unitless.
        -   `atan($number)`. Input must be unitless.
        -   `atan2($y, $x)`. `$y` and `$x` must have compatible units or be unitless.

-   Add the variables `$pi` and `$e` to the built-in "sass:math" module.

##### JavaScript API

-   `constructor.value` fields on value objects now match their Node Sass
    equivalents.

</details>

Issues.Title: Inconsistent use of exported bundles for an ES5 build vs an ES2015 build with differential loading
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? unsure ### Description The angular build features differential loading (awesome!), i.e. the build optionally generates two copies of the app, one for es2015 and one for es5. The es5 code however seems to be the es2015 version of the full application build transpiled to es5. I think that this is incorrect, the build should pick up the dedicated es5 exports from libraries it uses. In its current form it assumes that the es5 exports of all libraries are transpiled versions of their es2015 exports. This is not necessarily true. A library could decide to use hand-optimized version for es5 and es2015. If I configure the Angular application build to use es5 as a target, then the build process would use the es5 exports of the libraries. The Angular package format documentation clearly documents different es5 and es2015 entry points into libraries. I would expect them to be used consistently. ## üåç Your Environment

Issues.Title: RC8 Breaks Hybrid App in IE11 Because of Upgrade to core-js 3.6.0 in @angular-devkit/build-angular
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [x] build - [x] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: 9.0.0-RC7 ### Description We are having an issue in IE11 where the download of the vendor.js and main.js files during a `ng build` or `ng serve` never completes. It shows a pending forever in the network tab and we theorize that this is because it is getting some kind of parsing error. We first tracked it down to the @angular-dev-kit/build-angular and then to this commit (https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/commit/6ffa74acead4798a42f82b4a3001fec26625d738) which upgraded core-js 3.3.6 to 3.6.0 to the build-angular dependencies. Any build after this one (https://github.com/angular/angular-devkit-build-angular-builds/commit/cbd21fa9307631006689f42f2afeb986f5c4f5be) fails to load in IE11 with either a never ending spinner or a long running script error. No other errors ever present themselves in the console. For any build after the one listed above, if you go into the `node_modules/@angular-devkit/build-angular/node_modules` and delete the `core-js` folder, then node will revert to the project `core-js` folder (we can verify it works at 3.1.4, 3.3.6, and 3.5.0) and everything works just fine. We have tested this with the most recent commits/builds and this is still an issue with 3.6.4 of core-js. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction This is super hard to reproduce because we are running an AngularJS and Angular hybrid app with over half a million lines of code. We are not sure what in our build process is causing the issue but it is for sure being caused by the upgrade to version 3.6.x of `core-js`. We are very happy to do any kind of screen share or provide more information if that is required. We are attempting to make a project that makes this reproducable ## üî• Exception or Error The only error is sometimes it errors with "...not responding due to a long running script" ## üåç Your Environment 

Angular CLI: 9.0.0-rc.9
Node: 12.13.0
OS: darwin x64

... platform-browser-dynamic, router, service-worker, upgrade
Ivy Workspace: Yes

Issues.Title: Regression problem in tsconfig.json outDir that cause VSCode showing errors in all import form libs poited with paths under /dist/...
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command - [x] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: 8.3.23 ### Description The root tsconfig.json used in the new v9.0.0-rc* template point `"outDir": "./dist"` That caused annoying problem in VSCode when you rebuild libs referred by `"paths"` all the code `imports {...} from lib` is marked as Errors by TS because they are build under `/dist/...` ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Run those commands: ``` npx @angular/cli@next new --createApplication=false my-workspace cd my-workspace npm run ng -- generate library my-lib npm run ng -- generate application my-app ``` The above commands are needed to setup the workspace for the repro with an application and a library pointed in the tsconfig.json ```"paths": { "my-lib": ["dist/my-lib"] }``` then add this line to app.module.ts to use the library inside the application: ``` // app.module.ts import { MyLibModule } from 'my-lib'; ``` and then run the compilation of the my-lib project in watch mode: ``` npm run ng -- build project=my-lib --watch ``` You will see in VSCode that all imports pointing to the my-lib will be signal as TS Errors 2307 ## üî• Exception or Error 

Can't find module 'my-lib' ts(2307)
## üåç Your Environment 

Angular CLI: 9.0.0-rc.9
Node: 12.14.1
OS: darwin x64

Angular: 9.0.0-rc.9
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router
Ivy Workspace: Yes

Package                            Version
------------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect          0.900.0-rc.9
@angular-devkit/build-angular      0.900.0-rc.9
@angular-devkit/build-ng-packagr   0.900.0-rc.9
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer    0.900.0-rc.9
@angular-devkit/build-webpack      0.900.0-rc.9
@angular-devkit/core               9.0.0-rc.9
@angular-devkit/schematics         9.0.0-rc.9
@ngtools/webpack                   9.0.0-rc.9
@schematics/angular                9.0.0-rc.9
@schematics/update                 0.900.0-rc.9
ng-packagr                         9.0.0-rc.7
rxjs                               6.5.4
typescript                         3.6.4
webpack                            4.41.2
**Anything else relevant?** I tested this issue using VSCode and it is related to **latest CLI v9.0.0-rc**, but the same behaviour is CORRETLY WORKING without any issue in the previous CLI v8 (tested and works on ~8.2.23)

Issues.Title: Add dynamic list as additional input type for x-promt (schematic)
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request

### Command (mark with an `x`)
- [x] generate

This feature request is actually about extending the functionality of schematics themselves. `ng generate` is just involved as the requested feature would be accessed through the command.

### Description
Today schematic promts are limited to a fixed set of compile time response values. To allow more advanced scaffolding use cases we also need the ability to dynamically (runtime) generated valid response values.

### Describe the solution you'd like
- Add new promt input type `dynamic-list` or similar
- Provide standardized way of filling the dynamic lists from within schematic code

### Describe alternatives you've considered
Open to any suggestions.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add dynamic list as additional input type for x-promt (schematic)" (#16705)

Issues.Title: refactor(@angular/cli): remove use of process.exit
Issues.Body:
process.exit() can cause the loss of asynchronous I/O.  This can include console output which may internally be asynchronous.
Reference: https://nodejs.org/api/process.html#process_process_exit_code


Closing for now pending additional investigation.  It appears that there are pending async tasks that are preventing the natural exit of the application.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "refactor(@angular/cli): remove use of process.exit " (#16699)

Issues.Title: build: fix local browser testing target for macOS and linux
Issues.Body:
Fixes the local browser testing target for macOS and Linux. The target is still somewhat broken on Windows due to a Bazel change in behavior: https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/issues/10621.

There is a valid workaround for windows though, so it's should be good to move forward with this. It's still the recommended approach by `rules_nodejs` that web test target's can be run with `bazel run`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: fix local browser testing target for macOS and linux" (#18237)

Issues.Title: build: coercion types rule should check type assignability
Issues.Body:
Currently the coercion types lint rule enforces compatibility
with the `async` pipe and strict null checks, by enforcing that
the input is assignable to `null` and `undefined`.

This is currently done by checking for known types (like
`BooleanInput`), or by checking for explicit type unions.

This is not very robust, and unflexible if new type aliases are
introduced. Since we updated to TS 3.7, we can leverage the type
relation API (which is now available; but just not exposed publicly
yet). For our lint rule, it should be fine using it already. We'll get
notified if something changes internally (which is unlikely though)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: coercion types rule should check type assignability" (#18223)

Issues.Title: [mat-chip-list] Change event doesn't provide reliable results and breaks when multiple property is changed
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

StackBlitz to reproduce issue(s): https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-14snje

Steps to reproduce:
1. Click "One Fish"
2. Change event says that "One Fish" is the only selected chip even though 2 other tags are also selected
3. Click "toggle multiple" to disable multiple selection
4. Click "Two Fish"
5. "One Fish" and "Two fish" are shown to be selected, but the change event says only "One Fish" is selected
6. Click "One Fish"
7. Now the change event says that only "Two Fish" is selected
8. Remove HTML attribute "multiple" from mat-chip-list in code and restart app
9. Click "One Fish"
10. Only "One Fish" is selected
11. Click "toggle multiple" to enable multiple selection
12. Click "Two Fish"
13. Both "One Fish" and "Two Fish" are shown to be selected, but the change event says that only "Two Fish" is selected
 
#### Expected Behavior

The change event triggered by mat-chip-list should always match the chips that are visually marked as selected.
When the multiple property is changed to false, only the first selected chip should remain selected.

#### Actual Behavior

1. The list doesn't include pre-selected chips in the first change event (i.e. chips that are selected at their creation time)
2. If multiple is initially false and then later changed to true, the change-event values array never contains more than 1 value even though multiple tags can be visually marked as being selected

#### Environment

- Angular: 8.2.14
- CDK/Material: 8.2.3
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[mat-chip-list] Change event doesn't provide reliable results and breaks when multiple property is changed" (#18245)

Issues.Title: [cdk-virtual-scroll-viewport][mat-table] - sticky headers is not working properly when combining mat-table with cdk-virtual-scroll-viewport
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: https://stackblitz.com/fork/components-issue
https://stackblitz.com/edit/virtual-scroll-table-sticky-headers

Steps to reproduce:
1. wrap mat-table within a cdk-virtual-scroll-viewport element
2. add sticky: true property to *matHeaderRowDef directive as stated in documentation
3. observe sticky header slide down the viewport after about 10 rows. 
 
#### Expected Behavior
Expect when adding the sticky:true; property to mat-table *matHeaderRowDef directive wrapped within a cdk-virtual-scroll-viewport that the headers remain positioned at the top of the viewport.

#### Actual Behavior
As you scroll the cdk-virtual-scroll-viewport slides the entire mat-table instead of just the row contents wrapped in the tbody element.

#### Environment

- Angular: >= 7
- CDK/Material: >= 7
- Browser(s): chrome, firefox, opera, safari
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): all
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[cdk-virtual-scroll-viewport][mat-table] - sticky headers is not working properly when combining mat-table with cdk-virtual-scroll-viewport" (#18240)

Issues.Title: @angular/google-maps | Issue Setting a Custom Marker Icon
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal: Setting a custom icon seems to trigger an infinite loop.
{{ currentlySelectedTruckTask?.customerFirstName }}
map.component.ts ... getMarkerOptions(item: T): google.maps.MarkerOptions { return { icon: '/assets/map-icons/emergency-icon.png', draggable: false }; } #### What is the expected behavior? Have getMarkerOptions only called once per map-marker. #### What is the current behavior? Code gets called recursively, as if responding to change detection, until it overflows. It seems to work fine with static MarkerOptions. #### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected? "@angular/core": "~8.2.14", "@angular/google-maps": "^9.0.0-rc.0", #### Is there anything else we should know? I do not believe so.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "@angular/google-maps | Issue Setting a Custom Marker Icon" (#18233)

Issues.Title: Datepicker Component Does Not Honor `updateOn` Configuration When No Year Is Present
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-dxyamu?file=src/app/datepicker-start-view-example.ts
Original, misfiled ticket with information that does not fit this project's template: https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/34873

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a datepicker input and link to a `FormControl` with `updateOn: 'blur'`
2. Delete characters starting at the rightmost and remove the year

Note how `valueChanges` will not fire while deleting the year, but will fire for every keypress subsequent to deleting the year. This behavior gets less predictable when not simply deleting the year; for example, starting to delete at the first digit of the year and continuing past the slash and into the digits representing month.
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

`valueChanges` does not fire until the input field is `blur`ed


#### Actual Behavior

`valueChanges` updates on every keypress when no year is present.

![matdatepicker valuechanges](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2379809/72751713-32570e80-3b75-11ea-8da6-23335e2bd15e.gif)


#### Environment

The issue may be caused by package **@angular/forms**
Present in Angular ~7 in our organization's application, as well as in the linked StackBlitz running Angular ~8.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Datepicker Component Does Not Honor `updateOn` Configuration When No Year Is Present" (#18229)

Issues.Title: fix(drag-drop): error if next sibling is removed after drag sequence has started
Issues.Body:
When a drag sequence is started, we save a reference to the next sibling of the drag element so that we can use it at the end of the sequence to restore the element's original DOM position. This breaks down and throws an error if the next sibling gets removed while the user is dragging. These changes make the approach a bit more robust by inserting a comment node instead.

Fixes #18205.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(drag-drop): error if next sibling is removed after drag sequence has started" (#18230)

Issues.Title: Change the year range in a multi-year view in mat-datepicker
Issues.Body:
**Feature Description** 

The possibility to control the year range in a multi-year view in the mat-datepicker in Angular Material 7. 

**What is the current behavior?** 

Currently the default range of 24 years starts from 2016-2039, and each page backwards offers another 24-year range. 

**Use Case** 

I need to show a different year range in the multi-year view in the mat-datepicker. I need the possibility to manipulate the year range to be different than the default (which is 2016-2039 in the starting view), e.g. 2010-2033.
This will improve the UX of an application where customers mostly select years beginning from 2010 (customers now need to go to the previous page with a year range from 1992-2015.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Change the year range in a multi-year view in mat-datepicker" (#18227)

Issues.Title: fix(material/input): input harness not matching `matNativeControl`
Issues.Body:
The input harness currently only matches `[matInput]`, but does
not match `[matNativeControl]` usages. Since both names, resolve
to the same directive, we should ensure that the harness works for both
possible usages.

Issues.Title: generate Theme on Demand like material 1
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

In angular material 1 it is possible to generate/swap themes dynamically with option [generateThemesOnDemand](https://material.angularjs.org/latest/Theming/04_multiple_themes)

#### Use Case

I have a requirement to use color pallet based on domain. And site has one copy deployed with multiple domains.

In angular material 1 with `generateThemesOnDemand `this can be done easily

#### What is the current behavior?
Only static theming is possible, where you have to generate your css files from sass in advance.

#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?
Multi-tenant systems with single hosting.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "generate Theme on Demand like material 1" (#18219)

Issues.Title: chore: store dev-app dark/light theme state in localStorage
Issues.Body: It's a pain to debug components' dark theme when every time you make a change the site reloads and goes back to light theme. This just makes it remember the previous value when the dev-app loads.
